DOCNAME: CASE OF BUSCARINI AND OTHERS v. SAN MARINO
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 9;Non-pecuniary damage - finding of violation sufficient;Costs and expenses - claim dismissed
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were elected to ORG ( the parliament of GPE ) in elections held on DATE .

CARDINAL . Shortly afterwards , they requested permission from ORG , who act as the heads of government in GPE , to take the oath required by section CARDINAL of LAW ( Law no . DATE ) without making reference to any religious text . The LAW in question referred to a decree of DATE , which laid down the wording of the oath to be taken by members of the ORG ’s parliament as follows :

“ I , … , swear on the Holy Gospels ever to be faithful to and obey LAW , to uphold and defend freedom with all my might , ever to observe the Laws and Decrees , whether ancient , modern or yet to be enacted or issued and to nominate and vote for as candidates to the ORG and other ORG only those whom I consider apt , loyal and fit to serve the Republic , without allowing myself to be swayed by any feelings of hatred or love or by any other consideration . ”
CARDINAL . NORP In support of their request the applicants referred to LAW of DATE , which guarantees the right to freedom of religion , and LAW .

CARDINAL . At the General Grand Council session of DATE the applicants took the oath in writing , in the form of words laid down in the decree of CARDINAL DATE save for the reference to the Gospels , which they omitted . At the same time , the first applicant drew attention to the obligations undertaken by GPE when it became a party to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of ORG gave an opinion , at the request of ORG , on the form of the oath sworn by the applicants , to the effect that it was invalid , and referred the matter to the ORG .

CARDINAL . At its session of CARDINAL DATE ORG adopted a resolution proposed by ORG ordering the applicants to retake the oath , this time on the Gospels , on pain of forfeiting their parliamentary seats .
CARDINAL . The applicants complied with the ORG ’s order and took the oath on the Gospels , albeit complaining that their right to freedom of religion and conscience had been infringed .

CARDINAL . Subsequently DATE before ever the applicants applied to ORG no . CARDINAL of DATE ( “ Law no . CARDINAL ” ) introduced a choice for newly elected members of ORG between the traditional oath and one in which the reference to the Gospels was replaced by the words “ on my honour ” . The traditional wording is still mandatory for other offices , such as that of Captain - Regent or of a member of the government .
